ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Can't compile heritrix
ygData.msgSnippet: This looks like it could be another manifestation of an issue that was introduced by Oracle with JDK6u23/JDK6u24. The behavior of GZIPInputStream was changed,

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Can't compile heritrix
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=jxPrNX6WjzDMEbjIVjre1y_fxiKMO9W0lTc8hLHAj8w4
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

This looks like it could be another manifestation of an issue that was 
introduced by Oracle with JDK6u23/JDK6u24. The behavior of 
GZIPInputStream was changed, and another bug in handling the GZIP 
'extra' fields as we use in (W)ARC writing introduced.

The latest H3 source in SV trunk has a workaround, but the H3.0.0 
release source still relies on the older GZIPInputStream behavior.

So, if you are encountering this with JDK6u23/JDK6u24, some options are to:

(1) Go back to JDK6u22 or earlier; or

(2) Use the latest source from SVN trunk.

Unless you already have experience/confidence in the earlier code, I 
recommend course (2) for active developers. You will sometimes encounter 
new issues that exist only in the actively-developed code, but you'll 
also have the advantage of the latest fixes/features, and be more ready 
for your extensions to work in the next official release.

- Gordon @ IA
